intro: Paronychia johnstonii, commonly known as Johnston's sandwort, is a low-growing flowering plant native to arid regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the family Montiaceae and is characterized by its small, fleshy leaves and clusters of white or pink flowers. The plant thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. It is often found in rocky or sandy habitats, where it forms dense mats. Paronychia johnstonii plays a role in stabilizing soil in its native environment and is of interest to botanists studying xerophytic adaptations.
